The most memorable ad during Sunday's Super Bowl- Chrysler's historic two-minute spot featuring rap star Eminem- was a gut-wrenching decision for the carmaker's chief executive Sergio Marchionne . This was not an easy choice... apart from the money involved... and this is pretty expensive stuff, but you know, the choice of the topic, the choice of the characters in the thing were not easy choices. I had to think about this really long and hard, Sergio Marchionne said. Why? I asked him. "You know, I love Eminem but... I also know that some of the choices of language that he has made are things that are not what I would

from a year ago to$ 10.76 billion as the company made market-share gains on the strength of 16 all-new or refreshed vehicles. Revenue, however, dipped slightly from the third quarter on reduced shipments. It can safely be said that what Chrysler delivered last year, on both the product and financial fronts, surpassed many expectations, CEO Sergio Marchionne said. "However, our job is not yet done. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of "Googled: The End of the World As We Know It."' I think Eric Schmidt is burned out."
